newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Arts Optical issues 84.5 mln shrs at HK$1.00 each.
newsitem.headline: Arts Optical issues 84.5 mln shrs at HK$1.00 each.

text.p: Optical frame manufacturer Arts Optical International Holdings Ltd said on Monday it is offering 84.5 million shares at HK$1.00 per share.
Public subscription will start from October 29 to November 1 and dealing in shares is expected to begin on November 8.
Arts Optical forecast a combined profit after taxation but before extraordinary item of not less than HK$46 million for the year ended December 31, 1996, it said in a statement.
Hambro Dah Sing Ltd is the sponsor, manager and lead underwriter of the issue.

The company said it expected to raise HK$74 million after expenses, in which HK$20 million would be used to expand the group's production capacity, HK$10 million to acquire licences for recognised brand names and HK$20 million to purchase production equipment for titanium frames.
It said another HK$10 million would be for acquisition of brandname distribution licences and the balance would be used to repay bank borrowings and as general working capital.

The company produces a wide range of plastic-based and metal optical frames which are sold under-customer private labels, such as DKNY, Pierre Cardin, Etienne Aigner, Rodenstock, Courreges, Bill Blass and Jones New York.
